tweet:
I'm so proud to be the daughter of Lucille Beserra Roybal. She raised me and Lillian and Eddie with such love and care. Her compassion and wisdom brightened our home and our community every day. Love you, Mom.

Best wishes to all moms this #MothersDay. https://t.co/sj069VogID

This #NationalNursesWeek, I stand in solidarity with @NationalNurses and nurses across the country as they demand the protections they need to do their jobs safely during the #COVID19 pandemic. We need to get more PPE to the frontlines of this pandemic immediately. #ProtectNurses

Insto a DHS y HHS que unan a los niños con sus patrocinadores cuanto antes, y que le pongan fin al Memorando de Acuerdo que la Administración de Trump ha utilizado para deportar a sus seres queridos. Los niños necesitan ser retirados de las instalaciones congregadas AHORA. https://t.co/hYuBab1Ajy

I'm urging DHS & HHS to unite children in their care with sponsors as quickly as possible, & end the Memorandum of Agreement the Trump Admin has used to deport a child’s loved ones. COVID's rapid spread makes it even more vital that kids be removed from congregate facilities NOW. https://t.co/hYuBab1Ajy

Mayo es el Mes de la Concientización de la Salud Mental y es un recordatorio para que cuidemos de nuestro bienestar físico y salud mental. La pandemia puede causar sentimientos de ansiedad, estrés o depresión, lo que lleva a muchos en nuestra comunidad a sentirse abrumados. [1/3]

May is Mental Health Awareness Month, and it serves as a critical reminder for all of us to take care of both our physical and mental well-being. The current pandemic can cause feelings of anxiety, stress, or depression, leading many in our community to feel overwhelmed. [1/3]

Thanks to legislation I recently voted for, #CA40 health centers are receiving $5.2 million for COVID-19 testing from HHS. As we fight this pandemic, these funds will help expand local testing capacity as we work to contain this virus & save lives. https://t.co/tq35mkHGvI

Honrada de trabajar con @RepCartwright y colegas para presionar a OSHA en emitir normas nacionales estrictas en lugares de trabajo para mitigar la propagación de COVID-19. Debemos asegurarnos que OSHA haga cumplir estas normas críticas para proteger a TODOS nuestros trabajadores. https://t.co/OvmpMBWJai

Honored to work with @RepCartwright & colleagues in pushing OSHA to issue strong national workplace standards to mitigate COVID-19's spread. We must ensure OSHA implements & enforces these critical guidelines to protect ALL our workers & their communities from this deadly virus. https://t.co/OvmpMBWJai

Sec. DeVos' finalized Title IX rule undermines students' safety from campus sexual assault & harassment, and makes it more difficult for survivors to find justice. I'm cosponsoring the College Affordability Act, which would prevent Sec. DeVos from enforcing this devastating rule.

On this #NationalNursesDay, we say a heartfelt thank you to our nation's nurses, who are working so hard on this pandemic's frontlines to help those suffering from COVID-19. You're our heroes! #ThankYouNurses

As part of my ongoing work to prevent #CA40 families from slipping into homelessness, I am proud to cosponsor the Emergency Rental Assistance and Rental Market Stabilization Act, which will provide $100 billion of urgently needed emergency rental assistance.

Happy 88th birthday to Sra. Juana Beatriz Gutierrez, one of the founders of Mothers of East LA and a magnificent community activist for our Eastside and SELA communities. I’ve been proud to work with her since I was first elected to the California State Assembly! https://t.co/KG9Z7EouVA

At today's Labor-HHS Approps hearing on the response to COVID-19, Chair DeLauro posed my question about the CDC's disturbing exclusion from White House briefings & many areas of pandemic guidance. The CDC's authoritative voice must be a central element of our fight against COVID. https://t.co/YPItjhplDx

This #TeacherAppreciationWeek, I'm thankful for #CA40’s incredible teachers, like Mrs. Ylauan of Downey's Imperial Elementary! She’s converted her garage to look like her classroom, and is using Zoom to keep teaching her 3rd grade students. @ImperialDowney https://t.co/ke5VTD8m55

Para aquellos que necesitan alivio del calor, los Centros de Enfriamiento de Emergencia del Condado de Los Ángeles están abiertos desde el mediodía hasta las 6 PM el miércoles 6 de mayo y el jueves 7 de mayo. Vea las ubicaciones en https://t.co/PdpcS3Iu4l o llame al 211.

For those needing relief from the heat, free LA County Emergency Cooling Centers are open from noon to 6 PM on Wednesday, May 6, and Thursday, May 7. See locations at https://t.co/PdpcS3Iu4l or call 211.

Estoy luchando por las familias de #CA40 quienes luchan por pagar su renta o hipoteca. El jueves pasado, copatrociné #HR6515, para suspender las obligaciones de pago de renta residencial y de la hipoteca durante la pandemia. Anuncié la noticia el jueves en mi tele-ayuntamiento.

I'm fighting to help the #CA40 families struggling to pay their rent or mortgage. Last Thursday, I agreed to cosponsor #HR6515, to suspend residential rent and mortgage payment obligations during the pandemic. I announced the news on my Thursday tele-town hall.

En esta Semana de Reconocimiento a los Maestros, las aulas están cerradas pero los maestros siguen educando a nuestros estudiantes atreves de chats de video, correos electrónicos, mensajes de texto y llamadas telefónicas. ¡Demos gracias a los maestros por su trabajo incansable! https://t.co/8GjaRXptc2

This #TeacherAppreciationWeek, American classrooms may be closed, but teachers are using video chats, emails, texts, and phone calls to keep educating our students and make sure they complete their lessons. We thank our teachers for all their tireless work! https://t.co/bTJmrA32Ik

The #2020Census will help determine whether our communities get the resources we'll need in order to grow & thrive in the next decade. This #CensusDeMayo, be sure to fill out your 2020 #Census by mail, by phone at 844-330-2020, or online at https://t.co/5ukdFiZRrR! #WeCount

As the first Mexican-American congresswoman, I wish you a happy #CincoDeMayo! In these trying times, Mexico's 1862 victory at the #BattleOfPuebla is a stirring beacon of hope. It shows that dreams can come true if we stand firm, work hard, and show "ganas."

I thank FEMA for providing $2.7 million in grants to the California Military Department to feed & protect Californians during this pandemic. As DHS Approps Chairwoman, I oversee FEMA funding & will keep fighting for a forceful federal response to COVID-19. https://t.co/iGRlFsTKm9

SSI and VA beneficiaries who have eligible dependent children and did not file 2018 or 2019 taxes must register at https://t.co/m0Z9ELalAt by TUESDAY, MAY 5, to get their payment of $500 per eligible dependent added to their $1,200 economic impact payment. https://t.co/MJT41KtarH

Are you a health care provider who has conducted COVID-19 testing or provided treatment for uninsured individuals with COVID-19 on or after February 4, 2020? Visit https://t.co/wMDahZSTeG to begin the process of filing reimbursement claims for testing and treating the uninsured.

As Labor-HHS Appropriations Vice Chair, I strongly oppose the White House’s decision to block Dr. Fauci from testifying before our subcommittee. His expert insights would surely help inform our subcommittee’s work to fight this pandemic and protect public health. https://t.co/egWyxj8tJq

On this #MayDay2020, I applaud all of America's essential workers, both citizens and noncitizens. Our brave frontline workers are key to defeating this pandemic and keeping our communities safe. #ClapForWorkers

I'm co-leading the #COVID19 Cost Share Adjustment Relief Act, to ensure federal payment of all COVID-19-related FEMA aid for America’s state, local, tribal & territorial govts. We must help these govts preserve their financial stability amid this pandemic. https://t.co/7dpca9hgZI

Hoy aplaudo a los trabajadores, incluyendo los trabajadores esenciales de cuidado a largo plazo, cuidado en el hogar y hogares de personas mayores y personas discapacidadas durante el COVID-19. [1/2] @SEIU2015

I #ClapForWorkers today, including the essential long-term care, home care & nursing home workers who are looking after seniors & people w/ disabilities during COVID-19. I urge their employers to help these workers get the PPE & other protection they need to keep safe. @SEIU2015

Countless families in #CA40 are struggling over how to pay their rent or mortgage during this crisis. That’s why I’m cosponsoring #HR6515, which will suspend your obligation to pay your residential rent or mortgage during the #COVID19 emergency.

PLEASE SHARE: My office has UPDATED our list of free student meal sites in our 40th Congressional District, including sites in the Los Angeles, Montebello, Downey, Paramount & Bellflower Unified School Districts: https://t.co/x2MPBdSK35 https://t.co/24JecqAing

For #MayDay2020, I applaud America's essential immigrant workers, who make up 16.5 percent of the national healthcare workforce, and are critical to our efforts to care for the sick and save lives during the COVID-19 pandemic. #ClapForWorkers

An image on social media claims to show a fake stimulus check delivered by mail, in a white envelope with a postage stamp from Santa Ana, CA. This correspondence is a fake; DO NOT DEPOSIT this check if you get it. 
https://t.co/Ih3IF7EyLK

Due to #COVID19, children eligible for free or reduced-price school meals will get extra food benefits called Pandemic EBT (P-EBT) benefits. Families will get up to $365 per eligible child on their P-EBT card for food and groceries. Visit https://t.co/WAYLZ83vYi on how to apply.

On #MayDay2020, I #ClapForWorkers, including the #DACA recipients working essential jobs on the #COVID19 frontlines despite the President's efforts to sabotage the DACA program. The House has passed my #DreamAndPromiseAct so we can #ProtectDreamers — I urge the Senate to join us!

Free #coronavirus testing is available by appointment for ALL LA County residents, whether or not they are experiencing #COVID19 symptoms. County residents can book a testing appointment at https://t.co/klEPypKITZ.

Join me & my guest @LACountyDCBA Dir. Joseph Nicchitta for a conference call TODAY, Apr 30 @ 3PM PT on resources for #CA40 small businesses, nonprofits, workers, tenants & landlords. RSVP to Vanessa.Martinez2@mail.house.gov. Call in at 323-795-5155; use Conference ID 821542090#. https://t.co/nUr1bZOLT0

Join me & my guest @LACountyDCBA Dir. Joseph Nicchitta for a conference call Thu, Apr 30 at 3PM PT, on resources for #CA40 small businesses, nonprofits, workers, tenants & landlords. RSVP to Vanessa.Martinez2@mail.house.gov. Call in at 323-795-5155; use Conference ID 821542090#. https://t.co/8PyiEqQnSR

As we mark #DenimDay and Sexual Assault Awareness and Prevention Month, I'm joining all those who are wearing denim to affirm that there is NEVER an excuse to sexually assault someone, no matter how they are dressed. https://t.co/9essIAQqLP

Join me & my guest @LACountyDCBA Dir. Joseph Nicchitta for a conference call Thu, Apr 30 @ 3PM PT, on resources for #CA40 small businesses, nonprofits, workers, tenants & landlords. RSVP to Vanessa.Martinez2@mail.house.gov. Call in at 323-795-5155; use Conference ID 821542090#.

ALERT: Today, April 29, from 1:00 PM to 8:59 PM PT, @SBAgov systems are only accepting loans from lending institutions with asset sizes less than $1 billion, to assist small community lenders and help their small business customers access the Paycheck Protection Program.

If you or your loved ones are among the many Americans feeling stressed, fearful, or lonely during this pandemic, I hope you'll visit my Health Resources webpage, which includes a list of mental health websites and hotlines to help you cope. https://t.co/XMH9DXcY8M

As part of Congress's CARES Act, the Pandemic Unemployment Assistance program is now open to many Californians who didn't have access to aid before, including independent contractors and gig workers. Read more and submit a claim at https://t.co/YemHSB4uRI.

Elevated rates of #COVID19 complications & death among minorities exemplify the horrific health inequities in our society. As a former author of the #HealthEquity & Accountability Act (#HEAA), I’m continuing the fight against systemic health injustices by cosponsoring #HEAA2020. https://t.co/rt9SQdjQSg

As #seniors face this pandemic's devastation, we’re taking new action to safeguard their health and finances. As vice chair of the Task Force on Aging and Families, I proudly co-led today’s unveiling of our principles for protecting #OlderAmericans. https://t.co/hB1xbFt2AG

SSI and VA beneficiaries who have eligible dependent children and did not file 2018 or 2019 taxes must register at https://t.co/m0Z9ELalAt by Tuesday, May 5, to get their payment of $500 per eligible dependent added to their $1,200 economic impact payment. https://t.co/T3vwcuSlQc

I proudly voted for legislation to reopen @SBAgov’s Paycheck Protection Program to business loan applications. #CA40 applicants should apply quickly, as funds are limited and expected to run out soon! Find a #PPP lender near you at https://t.co/mcoORv6wv6.

Happy to be flying home after voting for #coronavirus relief to help our #CA40 communities. I'll keep fighting for new aid for our Southeast families and workers. Be sure to visit my website for resources to help you and your loved ones in this crisis: https://t.co/pRxOa4A6ID. https://t.co/nGy0SJjH2V

This #AlcoholAwarenessMonth, please remember that the stress of social isolation during this pandemic can lead to #AlcoholAbuse. If you need treatment and support for alcohol abuse during this time, please know there are telehealth services to help you at https://t.co/XQUhUx8z2f.

This #ArborDay, as we practice isolation & social distancing, it makes me even more grateful when I see the trees that brighten our communities. That's why I'm keeping up the fight in Congress to revitalize our LA River so we can bring new green spaces to Southeast neighborhoods.

As we commemorate the 105th anniversary of the Armenian Genocide and honor the memories of its victims, let us solemnly affirm that we reject denial of this or any genocide, and that we will speak out against bigotry and brutality wherever they appear.

As our #CA40 communities continue to seek #COVID19 testing, I thank @FEMA for providing $30.9 million for LA County testing sites. As DHS @AppropsDems Chair, I’ll keep fighting for federal funds to reduce COVID-19’s impact in CA-40 and nationwide. https://t.co/X30EMpoMHw

I voted in strong support of today’s bills to help protect American families, workers, and small businesses, and am continuing the fight to help my constituents and Americans all across the country as they face this devastating crisis. https://t.co/eH0mzvsUQs

Off to the Capitol to vote for new coronavirus relief funding, including billions for testing, hospitals, and PPE for health care workers, plus new funding access for small businesses in underserved areas. (I'm holding a statement about my support of today's bills.) https://t.co/fFEoDGSi7y

As author of #HR6, the #DreamAndPromiseAct, I and 100+ @HouseDemocrats call on @SenateMajLdr to hold a vote on HR 6. We MUST protect Dreamers & TPS recipients, including those in the medical field & other essential jobs who risk their lives to keep us safe.https://t.co/p4iHTQRsoJ

#RamadanMubarak! I wish all those observing #Ramadan a blessed month of joy and prayer. The U.S. is strengthened every day by the inspiring contributions of our Muslim American community, including all those who are saving lives on the front lines of the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/PAKfK2Ck3g

On this 50th anniversary of #EarthDay, I'm urging the @EPA to ensure all Americans have equal rights to clean air protections. We must protect our vulnerable communities from the consequences of environmental injustice. #EarthDay50 https://t.co/TUgy0LpHB5

As we observe #NationalMinorityHealthMonth, it’s utterly outrageous that minorities are facing elevated rates of #coronavirus infection, hospitalization, and death. I've co-sponsored a resolution urging immediate action to address these heartbreaking inequities. #NMHM2020 #NMHM

On my way to DC to vote for additional access to funding to help my constituents and all Americans during this coronavirus crisis, including billions for small businesses in underserved communities, hospitals and health workers in need of PPE, and more COVID-19 testing. https://t.co/ThZYbD5OsS

DACA recipients and undocumented immigrants studying at our colleges are preparing for careers dedicated to strengthening America. It's unconscionable for the Trump Administration to deny them the aid they need to make ends meet. https://t.co/0LiEnmzhHw

Today we celebrate #EarthDay's 50th Anniversary! Census-derived data helps us make environmental policy and understand environmental hazards in communities. I encourage you to take action to protect our communities by completing your #2020Census at https://t.co/5ukdFiZRrR today!

Deeply saddened to hear of Lewis MacAdams’s passing. I've led the congressional effort to revitalize our beloved LA River, and Lewis was an early and critical voice in our ongoing fight to make the river a clean, green space for all Angelenos to enjoy. https://t.co/G8PglUGuem

On this Holocaust Remembrance Day (Yom Hashoah), please join me in mourning the memories of the Holocaust’s victims, including the six million Jews who were murdered. In their names, we say #NeverAgain, and we rededicate ourselves to fighting genocide and bigotry.

President Trump is trying to divert attention from his mishandling of the coronavirus pandemic by once again using the pretext of the pandemic to attack immigrants and immigration. At the same time, he is continuing to undermine state efforts to minimize the impact of COVID-19.

SSA & Railroad Retirement beneficiaries who have eligible dependents & didn't file a 2018 or 2019 tax return have until 9AM PT/Noon ET on Wed, April 22, to register at https://t.co/prwyj5OtHn to have $500 per dependent added automatically to their $1200 Economic Impact Payment.

En este mes de Concientización y Prevención de Agresión Sexual, es aún más importante que nuestro gobierno haga todo lo posible para apoyar a sobrevivientes, ya que los efectos económicos y de salud por la pandemia causan dificultades para sobrevivientes al conseguir seguridad.

This Sexual Assault Awareness and Prevention Month, it's even more important for our government to do all we can to support survivors, as the health and economic effects of this pandemic make it even more difficult for many survivors to find safety. https://t.co/TRnsuf6V9H

As of today, #CD40 has a 41.3% response rate for the #2020Census. Make sure #CD40Counts #SELACounts #SouthLACounts #EastLACounts. Complete your Census today at https://t.co/5ukdFiZRrR! https://t.co/XwtUcaQQho

I stand with my @HispanicCaucus sisters and brothers in urging DHS & CDC to stop turning away unaccompanied children at our border. The Trump Admin needs to do the right thing, and honor America's longstanding commitments to protect vulnerable children & fight human trafficking. https://t.co/on1vwMJOHb

In these challenging times, if you're able to donate in-kind resources like PPE, food, and sanitizers/disinfectants to 501(c)(3) charities, or to state or local government entities like public schools, please do so. Your donations can make a big difference during this crisis.

VICTORY! Our Task Force on Aging and Families has called for veterans and their beneficiaries to get their economic impact payments without having to file taxes. Very pleased the Treasury has now agreed to deliver those payments automatically! https://t.co/nA4cHN0kud

Free #coronavirus testing is available at several LA County locations. Testing is limited to LA County residents with COVID-19 symptoms, such as fever, cough, and shortness of breath. Book a same-day or next-day appointment at https://t.co/klEPypKITZ.

NEW! Visit https://t.co/EVV4H2tgF1 to check your eligibility for an economic impact payment, see your payment status, confirm how you'll get your payment, enter/update your bank account info and mailing address, and add your payment info if you don't file taxes.

HASTA LAS 4:30 PM DE HOY, residentes del sur de Los Ángeles de #CA40 pueden solicitar la tarjeta sin cargo Angeleno, una tarjeta de débito para ayudar a los Angelinos en estos tiempos difíciles. [1/2]

UNTIL 4:30 PM TODAY, South LA residents of #CA40 can apply for the no-fee Angeleno Card, a debit card to help Angelenos in these difficult times. LA City residents can apply at https://t.co/jK61CZHS1V or by calling (213) 252-3040. [1/2]

I understand many in #CA40 find the census’s race question confusing. I encourage you to consider the question's options & answer with your best judgment. Every household must answer EVERY QUESTION on the #census questionnaire to ensure our communities have the resources we need.

Gracias @univision por el himno de #CuentaConmigo para el #Censo2020 con la ayuda de los @tigresdelnorte, @anabarbaramusic, Nataneal Cano y @Fuerza_regida. Y tú, ¿ya llenaste el #Censo? ¡Hazlo hoy en https://t.co/5ukdFiZRrR! #Distrito40cuenta https://t.co/x4rmvYFwpF

As California updates the list of foods WIC recipients can buy (https://t.co/V4gZgfHG1H), let's remember #Census data determines #WIC funding decisions. Help local families get the food they need by getting yourself counted in the #2020Census at https://t.co/5ukdFiZRrR.

Our Task Force on Aging and Families has been urging the Treasury Dept to let SSI recipients get stimulus checks without filing taxes. Today, we won a victory when Treasury agreed. I urge Treasury to end this filing requirement for VA pension holders, too! https://t.co/nWegaJZh0G

As we confront this pandemic, the safety of our loved ones and the future of our country depends on our leaders making smart decisions based on the facts and science. I stand with @SpeakerPelosi in this mission; when will the administration join us? https://t.co/whaTIQJYaQ
Beginning this Sunday, April 19, all @MetroLosAngeles buses and trains will begin running a modified Sunday schedule every day of the week. Read more at https://t.co/wPeiYncega.

Para residentes del sur de Los Ángeles de #CA40: La Ciudad de Los Ángeles estableció Angeleno Card, una tarjeta de débito sin cargo para ayudar a los Angelenos. Residentes pueden aplicar en https://t.co/jK61CZHS1V o al (213) 252-3040 de 8:30 AM a 4:30 PM, miércoles y jueves.

For South LA residents of #CA40: The City of LA is establishing the no-fee Angeleno Card, a debit card to help Angelenos in these difficult times. LA City residents can apply at https://t.co/jK61CZHS1V or by calling (213) 252-3040 from 8:30 AM-4:30 PM, Wednesday & Thursday.

Gracias al período de inscripción especial de @CoveredCA_es, cualquier persona sin seguro y elegible para inscribirse en la cobertura de atención médica a través de Covered California puede inscribirse hasta el 30 de Junio en https://t.co/kYYUtEefpo. (1/2)

Thanks to a @CoveredCA Special Enrollment Period, anyone uninsured and eligible to enroll in health care coverage through Covered California can sign up through June 30 at https://t.co/kYYUtEefpo. You may also be eligible for financial help to pay for coverage.

Para residentes del sur de Los Ángeles de #CA40: La Ciudad de Los Ángeles estableció Angeleno Card, una tarjeta de débito sin cargo para ayudar a los Angelinos. Residentes pueden aplicar en https://t.co/jK61CZHS1V o al (213) 252-3040 de 8:30 a.m. a 4:30 p.m., de martes a jueves.

For South LA residents of #CA40: The City of LA is establishing the no-fee Angeleno Card, a debit card to help Angelenos in these difficult times. LA City residents can apply at https://t.co/jK61CZHS1V or by calling (213) 252-3040 from 8:30 AM-4:30 PM, Tuesday-Thursday.

¿Ocupa una razón por la cual TODOS necesitan ser contados en el #Censo2020? Los datos del censo fueron usados para decidir cuánto financiamiento de CDBG obtienen nuestras ciudades para combatir el coronavirus. ¡No se demore, complete el censo HOY en https://t.co/5ukdFiZRrR! https://t.co/YKgb8FGaac

Want a reason why EVERYONE needs to get counted in the #2020Census? Census data was just used for deciding how much CDBG funding our cities get for fighting the coronavirus. Don't delay -- fill out the census TODAY at https://t.co/5ukdFiZRrR! https://t.co/71EYSPTIHW

Over 27,000 #DACA recipients are medical professionals on the COVID-19 frontlines. As an original #DreamAct co-author, I know #Dreamers love America and are essential to our nation. I call on DHS to auto-extend DACA recipients' work authorizations & give them a sense of security. https://t.co/UyhpI3XFKK

Happy #Easter! At this time of separation and hardship for so many around the world, may this joyous holiday bring together all who celebrate in a shared spirit of hope and compassion. https://t.co/4xAePBO5Oq

He firmado una carta urgiendo a la Administración de Trump que traduzca y distribuya de inmediato orientación pública sobre el coronavirus en español y otros idiomas. Todos los estadounidenses necesitan información actualizada en su idioma para guiarlos a través de esta pandemia.

Giving blood saves lives, and ensuring a stable blood supply during this pandemic is VITAL. If you're feeling healthy, you can make an appointment with the #RedCross to give blood at a local drive. Read how at https://t.co/JlNqFvQL0F. @RedCrossLA @RedCross

My thoughts are with the loved ones of Phyllis Lyon, a dedicated fighter for justice and equality, and an iconic LGBTQ Californian. Phyllis’s decades of advocacy helped build a brighter future for the people of our Golden State and all across America. https://t.co/cjRSzS8Yh7

This #NationalPublicHealthWeek, the coronavirus reminds us of #PublicHealth's vital role in promoting evidence-based & equitable policies that support good health for all. As Public Health Caucus Co-Chair, I’ll again be leading a resolution honoring this crucial week. #NPHW @NPHW

Our 40th District health centers are essential to our communities’ fight against the #coronavirus. As a strong supporter of the CARES Act, I’m thankful that HHS is channeling critical funding from this law to support health centers in our neighborhoods. https://t.co/mY2QDNOx9a
